remarks: Lemma for properties of the set of identities of ` G ` .  The set of identities of a monoid is exactly the unique identity element. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Dec-2014.)
statement:
gsumvallem2.b $e |- B = ( Base ` G ) $.
gsumvallem2.z $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` G ) $.
gsumvallem2.p $e |- .+ = ( +g ` G ) $.
gsumvallem2.o $e |- O = { x e. B | A. y e. B ( ( x .+ y ) = y /\ ( y .+ x ) = y ) } $.
gsumvallem2 $p |- ( G e. Mnd -> O = { .0. } ) $.
$d .+ x y $.
$d .0. x y $.
$d B x y $.
$d G x y $.
